alert.note: Alert for Humboldt; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 5:02AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest Nevada, including the following counties, in north central Nevada, Lander. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.4 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. Also, heavy rainfall from yesterday has caused the ground to become saturated, allowing any rainfall to run off quickly. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Battle Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
